Staff
Creating Lasting Experiences: Meet the Dedicated Staff Making Nathan Benderson Park a Premier Destination
Welcome to the heart of Nathan Benderson Park – our exceptional team. Each individual you meet here works tirelessly behind the scenes to ensure that your experience at our park is nothing short of memorable. From the meticulous maintenance of our grounds to the coordination of spectacular events and community programs, our staff’s dedication truly makes Nathan Benderson Park a gem of the Sarasota-Bradenton region. Let’s introduce you to the team that makes it all possible.
Bruce C. Patneaude
Chief Operating Officer
Sarah Hartz
Director of Events
Wendy Ghezzi
Director of Finance
Marnie Buchsbaum

Board of Directors
Steering the Course: Meet Our Board of Directors
At the helm of Nathan Benderson Park’s vision and initiatives is our dedicated Board of Directors. Comprising local leaders who share a passion for community growth and recreational prosperity, our board plays an instrumental role in guiding the park’s operations, projects, and strategic direction. Their commitment to making Nathan Benderson Park a world-class facility resonates through every inch of our verdant landscapes and inviting waters.
Michael Taaffe, J.D.
Chairman of the Board
Taaffe is a preeminent trial attorney and director of Shumaker’s Broker-Dealer and Data Breach Groups. He has a lifelong involvement with rowing, including service as a founding member and coach of Sarasota Crew, which he led to several regional, state and national championships.
Joanne Fava, D.C.
Secretary
Fava has overseen the medical side of the park since the beginning. She also helms a successful sports medicine practice.In 2024, she received the Volunteer of the Year Leadership Award and was award the SCOTY award by the American Chiropractic Board of Sports Medicine.
Curtis Jordan
Chairman Elect
Jordan has more than 30 years of experience as an elite international and intercollegiate coach, most recently with USRowing. Jordan coached the U.S. men’s coxed four in 1988 and 1992, the men’s four and bronze-medal lightweight four in 1996, and the lightweight men’s four in 2000.
Ron Cutsinger
Director
Cutsinger, a Sarasota County commissioner, has been a financial advisor and is the owner and managing director of Waypoint Wealth Management, a full-service financial services firm, for nearly 30 years. He is an active water sports enthusiast.
Linda De Mello
Director
Linda’s career is distinguished by her leadership of complex, dynamic, and diverse organizations and communities in the fields of healthcare, career and workforce development, and higher education.  Linda recently served as the Manager of the Cross College Alliance (CCA), a remarkable 21st Century partnership of five universities and colleges in Sarasota Manatee committed to leveraging the assets of each institution to collaboratively enhance the learning opportunities for all students, the excellence of the region’s workforce, and the quality of life available to all members of the community.
Molly Jackson
Director
Jackson serves on the board of The Gulf Coast CEO Forum, and served on the board for Girls Inc. for the last 6 years. She often shares her talent and expertise from her retail banking/finance where she served as a vice president for a premier private banking operation, extensive retailing experience, and omni-channel marketing perspective to not only help grow and expand their retail businesses but to also support the community and many non-profit organizations.
Louis Kosiba
Director
Louis Kosiba’s experience includes work with the Illinois Municipal Retirement Fund (1988-2017) Manager Field Services (1988-1990), General Counsel (1990-2001), Executive Director (2001-2017), Teacher’s Retirement System (1983-1988) General Counsel Florida Commitment, 2017 Retired and moved to Lakewood Ranch, 2018 Co-Treasurer for “Vote Yes For The Legacy Trail Extension”, a political action committee ( Sarasota County), 2019 President of The Friends of The Legacy Trail, 2020 Treasurer for “ Vote Yes for Water and Land”, a political action committee ( Manatee County ), 2020 Campaign Steering Committee member for Wildlife Center of Southwest Florida.
Jay Riley
Director
Riley is the Senior Director of Corporate Partnerships and External Affairs for the Office of External Affairs and Government Relations, University of South Florida Sarasota-Manatee; works with current and potential partners across all USF campuses to strategically identify and access the institution’s vast resources. He works closely with students, faculty and staff to effectively manage mutually beneficial partnerships between the university and stakeholders.
Ryan Thompson
Director
Thompson is a Sarasota native who has ties to NBP since inception having participated in the first unofficial race on the unimproved excavation pit in the early 2000s as a member of Sarasota Scullers Youth Rowing Program. Thompson is a Vice President and Shareholder at J.L. Bainbridge – Family Wealth Advisors and is board member at multiple local nonprofits.

Public Notice of Scheduled Board Meeting on September 18
Thursday, Sept 18 – Board of Directors Meeting
The Board of Directors of the Nathan Benderson Park Conservancy, Inc., a Florida not-for-profit corporation, has scheduled its next Board meeting for September 18, 2025 from 3:00-4:00pm. The meeting location will be announced shortly.
Please contact 941-358-7275  with any questions or to RSVP. General business will include Board governance and other matters as may come before the Board. All are welcome to attend.
The Nathan Benderson Park Conservancy, Inc. does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, religion, age, marital status or disability status in employment or in the provision of services.
According to Section 286.0105, Florida Statutes, any person desiring to appeal any decision made by the Board of the Nathan Benderson Park Conservancy, Inc. with respect to any matter considered at the meeting will need a record of the proceedings, and for such purposes may need to ensure that a verbatim record of the proceedings is made, which includes the testimony and evidence upon which the appeal is to be based.

Leadership Academy Presented by LWRBA
Register now for the Leadership Academy, in partnership with Game On Nation and hosted at Nathan Benderson Park. This is a fun and interactive 6-week program, designed for leaders in the upper levels of the organization, as well as mid-level and emerging talent on a fast-track toward a leadership role. If you’re looking to enhance your leadership skills, then this program is for you! Leadership Academy begins August 15th and runs August 22, and September 5, 12, and 19 from 8:30 am – 12:00 pm.

Public Notice of Scheduled Board Meeting on July 17
CANCELED – Thursday, July 17 – Board of Directors Meeting (Next Mtg in Sept)
CANCELED – The Board of Directors of the Nathan Benderson Park Conservancy, Inc., a Florida not-for-profit corporation,
IS CANCELLED FOR
July 17, 2025 from 3:00-4:00pm
.
The Nathan Benderson Park Conservancy, Inc. does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, religion, age, marital status or disability status in employment or in the provision of services.
According to Section 286.0105, Florida Statutes, any person desiring to appeal any decision made by the Board of the Nathan Benderson Park Conservancy, Inc. with respect to any matter considered at the meeting will need a record of the proceedings, and for such purposes may need to ensure that a verbatim record of the proceedings is made, which includes the testimony and evidence upon which the appeal is to be based.

Join Our Paddler & Rowing Memberships
Unlock access to premium equipment, coaching, and the lake
General Membership Info
Member Login
New Paddling Member
Learn More
New Rowing Member
More Info
General Membership Info
Member Login
Membership Overview
Nathan Benderson Park
is pleased to offer paddler and rowing memberships that give you full access to participate in our programs. With a membership, you’ll have access to all necessary equipment and the ability to easily launch on the lake. Whether you’re new to the sport or an experienced paddler, there’s an option for you.
Join the Florida Rowing Center to explore rowing membership opportunities or try your hand at outrigger canoe and kayaking in Florida. We are proud to offer specialized Veterans and Cancer survivor programs to support health and wellness.
Use Your Own Equipment
Prefer to use your own gear? You can add a boat storage rack to your membership so your personal watercraft is ready and available throughout the year.
Membership Includes
Access to paddling and rowing equipment.
Easy lake launch access.
Storage options for your own watercraft.
Membership Types
Nathan Benderson Park offers several membership options for both paddlers and rowers. Select from our volunteer or non-volunteer memberships and enjoy access to all the park’s facilities and programs. Volunteer members receive discounted rates in exchange for a commitment of 20 volunteer hours per year at NBP-approved events.
Volunteer Memberships
: Reduced fees with a 20-hour annual volunteer commitment.
Non-Volunteer Memberships
: Standard membership with no volunteer requirements.
Recurring Payments
Once you’ve completed the required agreement and waiver, our team will send you a secure link to set up recurring monthly payments, which will be automatically charged. Please note that membership requires a commitment and any cancellations will follow the park’s policies.
Paddling Memberships
Sign Up Today
Non-Volunteer

Join Today
All participants must complete Dragon Boat 101 prior to signing up for Membership. Registration must be at least 4 business days before the course.
Click Here to Sign Up for Dragon Boat 101!
We also offer specialized
paddling
programs
designed to support cancer survivors and veterans, providing a unique opportunity to engage in physical activity, build camaraderie, and experience the healing power of being on the water.
*Volunteer hours will accrue at the rate of 1.67 hours per month. (20 annually).
Hours not completed will be billed at the rate of $10 per hour if not completed by the 9/30/2025 deadline.
Hours can be rolled over for those signing from May-Sept. for the first year of the membership.
Members have the option to update their membership through their account.  Members changing from Non-Volunteer to Volunteer acknowledge they will begin accruing 1.67 hours once they make the change.
Discover the Benefits of Sarasota Crew Membership!
See Full Program Details
Nathan Benderson Park, the top rowing facility in the country, is pleased to partner with Sarasota Crew, one of the largest community rowing organizations in the nation, to deliver unparalleled excellence in rowing instruction. Whether you are a beginner or at an advanced skill level, Sarasota Crew is here to support your learning and growth to help you achieve your full potential.
Empowering Lives. One Rower At A Time.
More than a simple slogan, it is the reason Sarasota Crew was created in 2002, and why they have grown into one of the largest rowing programs in the country who succeed in not only producing national championships, but making a positive difference with every rower. Rowers from all walks of life come to Sarasota Crew, not because they focus on the importance of winning like other organizations, but because they create a healthy environment – socially, physically, emotionally – and teach the proper skill set to empower every rower to conquer the next challenge in their life.
New Adult Rowers
Experienced Adult Rowers
Membership & Storage Options
Explore flexible membership options including weekly, seasonal, and annual plans, tailored for both experienced rowers and those new to the sport. For full details, benefits, and membership rules, please visit the
Sarasota Crew website
.

25
October 25 @ 4:00 pm
-
8:00 pm
Water Lantern Festival
While they're called many things such as lantern festivals, lights festivals, floating lanterns, water fest, or Chinese lanterns - only Water Lantern Festival allows you to Light The Water in a way you'll never forget. Experience the magic of thousands of lanterns as the soft lights reflect upon the water.  Water Lantern Festival is filled with fun, happiness, hope, and great memories that you'll cherish for a lifetime. This is a family friendly event that can be shared by everyone. Friends, families, neighbors, and lots of people that you haven't met can come together to create a peaceful, memorable experience. Gates open at 4 p.m., with launch from 7-8 p.m. Design your own lantern, and send your own well wishes aglow across the lake. Food trucks will be on-site, along with music and fun.  For more details, visit Water Lantern Festival Info

Out Of The Darkness Suicide Prevention Walk
Regatta Island
5851 Nathan Benderson Circle, Sarasota, FL, United States
Community walk for American Foundation for Suicide Prevention to raise money for research, education, advocacy and support for those impacted by suicide. Benefits the American Foundation for Suicide Prevention. The Community Walks, held in hundreds of communities across the country, are the core of the Out of the Darkness movement, which began in 2004. These events give people the courage to open up about their own connections to the cause, and a platform to create a culture that’s smarter about mental health. Friends, family members, neighbors and coworkers walk side-by-side, supporting each other and in memory of those we’ve lost.

Regatta Island
5851 Nathan Benderson Circle, Sarasota, FL, United States
Across the nation, the Alzheimer's Association Walk to End Alzheimer's is full of flowers, each carried by someone committed to ending this disease. Because like flowers, our participants don't stop when something's in their way. They keep raising funds and awareness for a breakthrough in the fight against Alzheimer's and all other dementia. Event begins at 8 a.m. and walk begins at 9 a.m.
